qas.question: What is the most common group of languages spoken in Mediterranean Europe?
What are the three main areas of southern Europe where Italian speakers can be found?

answers.text: Italy, San Marino, and the Vatican

qas.question: Where can people who speak Catalan be found?
What language is spoken in northwest Spain?
How many people in Spain and Gibraltar are Spanish speakers?
What is the most common group of languages spoken in Catalan?

plausible_answers.text: Italy, San Marino, and the Vatican

qas.question: What are the three main areas of southern Europe where Latin speakers can be found?
How many people in Spain and France are Spanish speakers?
How many people speak Italian in Europe?
What languages are emblematic of northern Europe?

context: The most widely spoken family of languages in southern Europe are the <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>Romance languages<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, the heirs of Latin, which have spread from the Italian peninsula, and are emblematic of Southwestern Europe. (See the Latin Arch.) By far the most common romance languages in Southern Europe are: Italian, which is spoken by <b8_0>over 50 million people<b8_0/> in <a1_0><b6_0>Italy, San Marino, and the Vatican<b6_0/><a1_0/>; and Spanish, which is spoken by <a4_0><b7_0>over 40 million<b7_0/><a4_0/> people in Spain and Gibraltar. Other common romance languages include: Romanian, which is spoken in Romania and Moldova; Portuguese, which is spoken in Portugal; Catalan, which is spoken in <a2_0>eastern Spain<a2_0/>; and <a3_0>Galician<a3_0/>, which is spoken in northwestern Spain.
